p: NSP6 is a membrane protein of approximately 34 kDa with six transmembrane helices and a highly conserved C-terminus [ 39] (Fig. 3c). Inserted in the ER membrane [ 15], it associates with Nsp3 and Nsp4 multi-pass transmembrane proteins during the assembly of coronavirus replication complex to form DMVs [ 16]. Transfection of Nsp6 produces single-membrane small vesicle clustering around the microtubule-organizing center (MTOC). Interestingly, its co-transfection with Nsp4 has a negative effect on this phenotype and Nsp6 is relocalized outside the MTOC area. The microtubule scaffolding does not seem necessary for productive infection [ 40]; however, several members of the RTC circulate in the cell through the microtubules.
